Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the benefits of the Republican tax cut plan for the middle class, as the Tax Policy Center found that most of the benefits go to the top 1 percent.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the middle class are the "big beneficiaries" of the tax cut plan.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Republican tax cut plan will primarily benefit the middle class, without acknowledging the findings of the Tax Policy Center.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or perspectives, such as the analysis from the Tax Policy Center that shows the benefits primarily go to the top 1 percent.
